content:
To convert a date string in cell B3 to epoch time and then to GMT-5, you can use this formula:
```scss
=(((B3-(5/24))-DATE(1899,12,30))*86400)
```
This formula will give you the number of seconds elapsed since the epoch (12/30/1899 12:00 AM) in GMT-5. To convert this number back to a date string in GMT-5, use the following formula:
```scss
=TEXT((((B3-(5/24))-DATE(1899,12,30))*86400)/86400+DATE(1899,12,30),"MM/DD/YYYY hh:mm:ss AM/PM")
```
Place the second formula in a new cell, and the result should be:
```
01/17/2023 12:26:31 PM
```
This result is the date and time from cell B3, converted to epoch time and then to GMT-5 and kept in the format `MM/DD/YYYY hh:mm:ss AM/PM`.
